comment.author: 50180751@N03
comment._content: i have never understood the need for glasses when you cant see. are their eyes more sensitive to the light?

comment.author: 41807318@N06
comment._content: Maybe even though blind, their eyes are still sensitive to light. Also, blind people sometimes have wonky looking eyes -- so maybe the sunglasses hide that. I dunno...but it looks very cool!

comment.author: 64848419@N07
comment._content: My boyfriend is blind. He doesn't always wear glasses but in the summer time he does often. Less than 10 percent of blind people can see nothing at all.  He can see light and for that reason he wears dark glasses. So that way the light isn't blaring. And he can see the little that he can more clearly.
